BitField.Name: NOP
BitField.Description: Write 0x0000 to Perform a NOP Command.

Register.Name: CH_FUNC_SETUP
Register.Notes: Channel A at least significant Address above, to access channel B use the least significant Address above + 1, etc.

Option.Description: Reserved. Voltage across screw terminals selected.
Reserved. Voltage across screw terminals selected.

BitField.Name: EN_50_60_HZ
BitField.Description: Enable 50/60 Hz Rejection and set the ADC Conversion Rate for channel conversions (Separate bit in "ADC_CONV_CTRL" for diagnostic conversions)

Option.Description: Enables the 50/60 Hz rejection resulting in a sampling rate of 20 Samples Per Second.
Disables the 50/60 Hz rejection resulting in a sampling rate of 4k8 Samples Per Second.
Enables 50/60 Hz noise rejection and HART noise rejection resulting in a sampling rate of 10 Samples Per Second.
Disables 50/60 Hz noise rejection resulting in a sampling rate of 1k2 Samples Per Second.

Register.Name: DIN_CONFIG
Register.Description: Digital Input Configuration Register per Channel

BitField.Name: DEBOUNCE_TIME
BitField.Description: This Bit Field Configures the Debounce Time on the DIN Pins.

BitField.Name: DEBOUNCE_MODE
BitField.Description: This Bit Determines the Operation of the DIN Debounce Logic.

BitField.Name: DIN_SINK
BitField.Description: Sets the Sink Current on the DIN Pins.
BitField.Notes:
On AD74413R(din_upgrade=1), all 5 bits(din_config<10:6>) are used to set the current.
On AD74412R(din_upgrade=0) then only the lower 4 bits(din_config<9:6>) are used to set the current.
Hence Fullscale DIN sink current =1.8mA on AD74412R.

BitField.Name: DIN_RANGE
BitField.Notes: Only Range0 is available on AD74412(ie. din_upgrade bit=0)

BitField.Name: COMPARATOR_EN
BitField.Description: Set to 1 to Enable the Comparator.

BitField.Name: INV_DIN_COMP_OUT
BitField.Description: Set to 1 to Invert the Output from the Comparator.

BitField.Name: COMP_INPUT_FILTERED
BitField.Description: Set to 1 to Select the Filtered Input to the Comparator.

BitField.Name: COUNT_EN
BitField.Notes: This function is only available if the fuse bit din_upgrade is set to 1. Setting this bit to 1 when when din_upgrade is 0 will not enable the counter.

BitField.Name: GPO_PAR_DATA_A
BitField.Description: When a pad is configured for parallel GPO data, this Bitfield Sets the logic Level of the GPO_A pin.

BitField.Name: GPO_PAR_DATA_B
BitField.Description: When a pad is configured for parallel GPO data, this Bitfield Sets the logic Level of the GPO_B pin.

BitField.Name: GPO_PAR_DATA_C
BitField.Description: When a pad is configured for parallel GPO data, this Bitfield Sets the logic Level of the GPO_C pin.

BitField.Name: GPO_PAR_DATA_D
BitField.Description: When a pad is configured for parallel GPO data, this Bitfield Sets the logic Level of the GPO_D pin.

Register.Name: GPO_CONFIG
Register.Description: General Purpose Output Configuration Register per Channel

BitField.Name: GPO_SELECT
BitField.Description: Select the General Purpose Output Mode.

Option.Description: The GPO pin is configured with a 100k pulldown resistor.
The GPO pin Logic state is set by the GPO_DATA bit.
The GPO pin is configured by the GPO_PAR_DATA bit in the GPO_PARALLEL register
The GPO pin is configured to output the debounced comparator output of the Digital Input Circuit
The GPO pin is configured in a high impedance state.

BitField.Name: GPO_DATA
BitField.Description: This Bit Sets the GPO Logic state When GPO_SELECT = 001

Option.Description: Drive a logic low on GPO_n pin.
Drive a logic high on GPO_n pin.

BitField.Name: I_LIMIT
BitField.Description: This Bit Sets the Source Current Limit in VOUT Mode.

BitField.Name: CLR_EN
BitField.Description: Enable Clear Function for the Channel.

BitField.Name: SLEW_LIN_RATE
BitField.Description: Update Rate for Digital Linear Slew.

Option.Description: The Digital Linear Slew controller updates at a rate of 4kHz.
The Digital Linear Slew controller updates at a rate of 64kHz.
The Digital Linear Slew controller updates at a rate of 150kHz.
The Digital Linear Slew controller updates at a rate of 240kHz.

BitField.Name: SLEW_LIN_STEP
BitField.Description: Step Size for Digital Linear Slew.

Option.Description: Digital Linear slew step size of 64 codes.
Digital Linear slew step size of 120 codes.
Digital Linear slew step size of 500 codes.
Digital Linear slew step size of 1820 codes.

BitField.Name: SLEW_EN
BitField.Description: Set to 1 to Slew to the Requested DAC Code.

Option.Description: Enable linear slew on the DAC output.
Enable HART compliant slewing on the DAC output.

BitField.Name: DAC_CODE
BitField.Description: 13-bit DAC Code Data for the Channel.

Register.Name: DAC_CLR_CODE
Register.Description: DAC Clear Code Register per Channel

BitField.Name: CLR_CODE
BitField.Description: DAC Clear Code for the Channel.

Register.Name: DAC_ACTIVE
Register.Description: DAC Active Code Register per Channel

BitField.Name: DAC_ACTIVE_CODE
BitField.Description: The Active DAC Code on the Channel.
BitField.Notes: If a DAC_CODEn register is written while the ldac_n pin is high, then the new DAC code is not passed to the analog domain until the ldac_n pin toggles low (or there is a SW ldac update ). DAC_ACTIVE can be used in this case to determine when ldac_n toggles low as DAC_ACTIVE does not update until the new code is passed to the analog domain. Also if slewing this field can be used to determine the current slew position.

BitField.Name: DIN_THRESH_MODE
BitField.Description: This Bitfield Sets the Reference to the DIN Threshold DAC.

Option.Description: Threshold is set between GND and AVDD.
Threshold is set between GND and 16V.
Stop Continuous Conversions and Leave the ADC Powered up or Power up the ADC.
Stop Continuous Conversions and Power Down the ADC or Power Down the ADC.

BitField.Name: DIAG0_ASSIGN
BitField.Description: Selects the Diagnostic Assigned to DIAG_RESULT[0].

Option.Description: Assign the Temperature Sensor to Diagnostic 0.
Assign the Charge Pump Voltage (AVSS) to Diagnostic 0.

BitField.Name: DIAG1_ASSIGN
BitField.Description: Selects the Diagnostic Assigned to DIAG_RESULT[1].

Option.Description: Assign the Temperature Sensor to Diagnostic 1.
Assign the Charge Pump Voltage (AVSS) to Diagnostic 1.

BitField.Name: DIAG2_ASSIGN
BitField.Description: Selects the Diagnostic Assigned to DIAG_RESULT[2].

Option.Description: Assign the Temperature Sensor to Diagnostic 2.
Assign the Charge Pump Voltage (AVSS) to Diagnostic 2.

BitField.Name: DIAG3_ASSIGN
BitField.Description: Selects the Diagnostic Assigned to DIAG_RESULT[3].

Option.Description: Assign the Temperature Sensor to Diagnostic 3.
Assign the Charge Pump Voltage (AVSS) to Diagnostic 3.

BitField.Name: DIN_COMP_OUT_A
BitField.Description: Debounced Digital Input State of Channel A

BitField.Name: DIN_COMP_OUT_B
BitField.Description: Debounced Digital Input State of Channel B

BitField.Name: DIN_COMP_OUT_C
BitField.Description: Debounced Digital Input State of Channel C

BitField.Name: DIN_COMP_OUT_D
BitField.Description: Debounced Digital Input State of Channel D

Register.Name: ADC_RESULT
Register.Description: ADC Conversion Results Register per Channel
Register.Notes: These registers can only be read if the fuse bit adc_data_24 is 0 and the test mode bit adc_data_24 is 0.

BitField.Name: CH_ADC_RESULT
BitField.Description: Contains the 16-bit Result of the ADC Conversion on Channeln

Register.Name: DIAG_RESULT
Register.Description: Diagnostic Results Registers per Diagnostic Channel.
Register.Notes: These registers can only be read if the fuse bit adc_data_24 is 0 and the test mode bit adc_data_24 is 0.

BitField.Name: DIAG_RESULT
BitField.Description: Contains the 16-bit Diagnostic Result on Diagnostic Channeln

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_A
BitField.Description: Voltage or Current Error Detected on Channel A.
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_B
BitField.Description: Voltage or Current Error Detected on Channel B.
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_C
BitField.Description: Voltage or Current Error Detected on Channel C.
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_D
BitField.Description: Voltage or Current Error Detected on Channel D.
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: ADC_CONV_ERR
BitField.Notes:
This bit is asserted if the DSP output data exceeds 24bits after truncation(typically caused by an analog input overrange).
When an ADC conversion causes this bit to be set, the ADC result is automatically set to all ones or all zeroes depending whether the error is an over-range or under-range. Subsequent conversions will overwrite the ADC result register.

BitField.Name: ADC_SAT_ERR
BitField.Notes: Indicates that the ones density of the modulator data stream is incorrect. If more than 20 consecutive modulator outputs equal logic high or low then this flag is set. When an ADC conversion causes this bit to be set, the ADC result is automatically set to all ones or all zeroes depending whether the error is an over-range or under-range. Subsequent conversions will overwrite the ADC result register.

BitField.Name: RESET_OCCURRED
BitField.Notes: A mask bit is not provided with this bit, because the mask bit would get reset by a reset event.

Register.Name: LIVE_STATUS
Register.Notes: NOTE: Bits only reset on POR.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_CURR_A
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_CURR_B
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_CURR_C
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: VI_ERR_CURR_D
BitField.Notes: This signal from the AFE has a 2ms integration style deglitch in user mode. However in testmode this delay is reduced to 200us.

BitField.Name: ADC_CH_CURR
BitField.Description: Address of the Channel Currently Being Converted by the ADC.

Register.Name: ADC_RESULT24_8
Register.Description: ADC Conversion Result Register per Channel (16 MSBs)
Register.Notes: These registers can only be read if the fuse bit adc_data_24 is 1 or the test mode bit adc_data_24 is 1.

BitField.Name: CH_ADC_RESULT24
BitField.Description: ADC Conversion Result on Channeln, Bits[23:8]

Register.Name: ADC_RESULT7_0
Register.Description: ADC Conversion Result Register per Channel (8 LSBs)
Register.Notes: These registers can only be read if the fuse bit adc_data_24 is 1 or the test mode bit adc_data_24 is 1.

BitField.Name: CH_ADC_RESULT24
BitField.Description: ADC Conversion Result on Channeln, Bits[7:0]

Register.Name: DIAGNOSTIC_RESULT
Register.Description: Diagnostic Results Registers per Diagnostic Channel.
Register.Notes: These registers can only be read if the fuse bit adc_data_24 is 1 or the test mode bit adc_data_24 is 1. The DIAG_RESULT registers are mirrored here to allow burst read when using the 24 bit ADC results registers.

BitField.Name: DIAGNOSTIC_RESULT
BitField.Description: Contains the 16bit Diagnostic Result on Diagnostic Channel

Register.Name: DIN_COUNTER
Register.Description: Debounced DIN Count Register per Channel.
Register.Notes: This count is allowed to roll over by design as in normal operation it's update rate should be slow.

BitField.Name: DIN_CNT
BitField.Description: Contains the 16bit Count from the DIN Counter.

Register.Name: READ_SELECT
Register.Notes: When uploading data in single read mode the actual register address associated with the data will be shipped in the SPI address field.

BitField.Name: READBACK_ADDR
BitField.Description: D7 to D0 contains the register address to be read.

BitField.Name: SPI_RD_RET_INFO
BitField.Description: Determines the Content of the MSBs in the SPI Read Frame.
BitField.Notes: When this bit is set to 1, 6 information bits are a FAULT flag, an ADC_RDY flag and the DIN comparator outputs are returned in bits [30:24] of any subsequent SPI read. (The FAULT flag is the inverse of the FAULTb pin and the ADC_RDY reflects the status of the ADC_DATA_RDY bit in the LIVE_STATUS register).

BitField.Name: CONV_SEQ_40SPS
BitField.Notes: If the fuse bit adc_40sps_dis is set then writing to this register will not start conversions. If the fuse bit adc_40sps_dis is 1 then this field is not available for writes. Reads will return 0.

Option.Description: Stop continuous conversions and leave the ADC powered up or power up the ADC.
Stop continuous conversions and power down the ADC or power down the ADC.

BitField.Name: EN_THERM_RST
BitField.Description: Set to 1 to Enable Thermal Reset Functionality.

BitField.Name: CMD_KEY
BitField.Description: Enter a Key to Execute a Command.
